intro: Hypoestes glandulosa, commonly known as the Indian blanket flower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, colorful bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or herb, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by showy, brightly colored leaves. Hypoestes glandulosa is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
